byline.contributor: James C. McKinley Jr. contributed reporting.

abstract: New York City Police Dept officials say use of obscure nuisance-abatement law will be reviewed; announcement follows news reports that raised questions about how police use the law, citing cases in which it was used to evict tenants without opportunity to for due process in court.

headline.print_headline: City to Review Nuisance Law  That Has Led to Evictions
headline.main: New York City to Review a Nuisance Law That Has Led to Evictions

snippet: A little-known, difficult to counter legal practice raises questions over aggressive policing and judicial oversight in which some residents have been forced from their homes.
lead_paragraph: A little-known, difficult to counter legal practice raises questions over aggressive policing and judicial oversight in which some residents have been forced from their homes.
